number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
												Important things first: I don't recommend buying the DLC, and if you buy it, only buy one of them, not all. They are not skills, they are costumes with bonuses. you can't have everything at the same time. Plus, the game doesn't really need to be easier.it's a wonderful sandbox game, where you do your thing while the world does its thing. you're on a timer, but you are not really in a hurry, pretty much everything is optional, and there are a ton of things to do. There will be times when the story won't progress until morning in half an hour, so you are free to goof around and explore and level up and discover the little things you can do, like watch a movie, or gamble your money at the casinos, tame a tiger etc.In other sandbox games, you'd to the same thing, but it wouldn't make sense. It's like in Fallout 4 where the protagonist's only objective is to rescue his son, but the player just forgets about it and travels the world. All in all, the timer is a good incentive that is genuinely motivating.If you skipped the whole thing, just read this: it is very fun and entertaining; and does things differently.

I never had the experience of playing this game, I first saw it on Xbox but if i seen the PC version i probably would have stayed as far away as possible, First of all my PC meets the requirements for this game, Yet it lags like S♥♥♥ i don't know why! Posted: March 24, 2016
												NO CONTROLLER SUPPORT! i for the life of me can't understand how a game like this doesn't offer controller support, i understand its an older game, but given its years and years later, plus the nature of moving around alot throughout the game, you would think they would come out with some kind of update to support controller use. So having said that my hopes are that someone sees this post in time and it spares someone the disappointment from downloading this thinking they can just hook their good ole pc remote up and go on a zombie killing spree, no you will be genuinely disappointed because thats not the case here. I would have thought it would be a huge topic of conversation throughout the reviews written but i only seen it mentioned a couple of times. Im not an avid gamer, only here and there, and with that being said i would much rather use a gamepad to play as opposed to fumbling all over the keyboard trying to remember whats what. Got a great deal on it, but had i known what i know now i wouldn't have even paid that, thumbs down!

content:
Posted: March 23, 2016
												=====Good things (at least for me)=====1. I love killing zombies2. I love story telling game3. Well...that reporter is sexy4. Millions of weapons and weapons combos5. Interesting characters (bosses)6. Decent map to roam around=====Bad things (at least for me)=====1. Weapon durability is too low - there are millions of zombies everywhere. You just hit few times and your weapons are gone. There are, of course, numerous things around which you can use as wepons. But when million zombies gang up on you, good luck reaching those things around you to use as weapon.2. Escort missions - you know right, it is boring to do that over and over and over and over and over and over again.3. Timer - timer is keep running out and you have to keep rushing to missions to missions without having enough time to have fun screwing around.Overall, game has potential to be a very fun and enjoyable game, but above mentioned negative things take away those enjoyments.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												Takes the open world zombie outbreak of the first game and improves it with larger world, easier controls, and combo weapons. The time-limited quests are still the most major flaw, since the story can easily be derailed if you wait too long to do a task. However, the game has great replay value, since you have to play through the three days of the outbreak multiple times to fully level up and unlock all the moves and weapons.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
												Hmmm. DR 2. The story's interesting. You can find new styles for Chuck. And you can eat just about anything along with using just about anything to kill zombies. The music's cheesy fun to listen to (if you pull up the map or pause the game). And the ways to get money (destroying atm's or registers, using the slot machines in  casinos etc) is a blast! And if you have to start the story over for some reason, it's very cool that your PP and level doesn't reset. So in some ways, it's really cool and fun.But in so many more ways, the game sucks. It sucks so much that for me personally it overshadows what makes the game great.  I hate leaving a bad review but I gotta do it. I'm so done with this game.And yes, I really tried to get through it, I really did. But I can't. I'm stuck on some aspects of it that just sucks , blows, AND wipes and I just gotta get it out of my system and move on.Ok. So the only save points are bathrooms. wtf??  The main and side missions...I get it's time based, it's part of the challenge. But you end up missing out on a lot of things. Sometimes I've had to stay on the main missions because if I don't do it in time the game's over--in a way. You get to keep playing, but what's the point if the story's over?? What about fast travel?? The time restraints are unrealistic in a made up game/world.The psychopath missions are next to impossible, because Chuck can't fight worth a crap. Unless he has to reach the maximum level of health first. Even then I can't see it being easy at all.AND HE CAN'T SPRINT and there's no mod to improve that?!? What in the actual hell?Also some of the button functionality's a little screwed up. I'd quick hold down my mouse button to do an attack move and sometimes it doesn't register and a zombie gets a hold of me.So, I guess what I'm getting at is, I would not recommend this to anybody who gets frustrated with games the same ways I do. Especially those that have experienced and gotten used to the amazing freedoms other games have generously offered.Sorry DR 2. You're no fun for me.
